results.content: Course is very brief and gives very small understanding about what's going on under the hood. What browser sends to the server, what server sends back to authenticate, how session handled by clients and  how spring security actually helps with authentication and authorization.  Also there is only one showcase with old jsp technology.
results.content_html: Course is very brief and gives very small understanding about what's going on under the hood. What browser sends to the server, what server sends back to authenticate, how session handled by clients and how spring security actually helps with authentication and authorization. Also there is only one showcase with old jsp technology.

Thank you for your course. It is nice presented and easy to understand.

And also it will be cool to see Intellij Idea instead of Eclipse.

results.content: Direct to the point and was very useful and easy to understand. Recommended to anyone who is planning to understand the Spring security module.

results.content: At the one hand it took some time to get the project setup working a few times (maybe git branches from GitHub would work better here) and the speaker didn't explain much background information (or concepts) about the things that are coded. But at the other hand I've also learned something which I liked.

But at the other hand I've also learned something which I liked.

results.content: Le is simply awesome. His concepts are crisp clear and he does it in front of you explaining every little detail. I love this course. Highly recommended if you want to understand spring security

results.content:
1) The course it pretty old, it use xml-based spring configuration.
2) I have already seen 3 lessons and don't hear anything about spring-security. There where some basic srping-mvc configurations at eclipse... but why? I want to see about security. And it was with bunch of small errors, so at the end we look at the cached page and not the one we already code.
3) about the slides: author just read the text on it, almost without any additional explanations.

response.content:
Hi Roman,

The course description says it will use xml configuration. If the content is not useful to you, it doesn't necessarily mean it's not useful to others. You can just simply skip to the content you want. 

Best,
Le

results.content: The lesson does not match the download.  The configuration setup is overly complex and does not need a web.xml file or application context.xml file if one uses Spring Boot.
results.content_html: The lesson does not match the download. The configuration setup is overly complex and does not need a web.xml file or application context.xml file if one uses Spring Boot.

results.content: There are different approaches for spring configuration. So the approach shared here is pretty old. Expecting at least to provide some details on latest approach.
results.content_html: There are different approaches for spring configuration. So the approach shared here is pretty old. Expecting at least to provide some details on latest approach.
